class Solution:
    def minimumCost(self, m: int, n: int, horizontalCut: list, verticalCut: list) -> int:
        # Sort the cuts in descending order
        horizontalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        verticalCut.sort(reverse=True)
        
        # Initialize the counters for pieces
        h_pieces = 1
        v_pieces = 1
        total_cost = 0
        
        # Use two pointers to process the maximum cuts first
        i, j = 0, 0
        while i < len(horizontalCut) and j < len(verticalCut):
            if horizontalCut[i] >= verticalCut[j]:
                total_cost += horizontalCut[i] * v_pieces
                h_pieces += 1
                i += 1
            else:
                total_cost += verticalCut[j] * h_pieces
                v_pieces += 1
                j += 1
        
        # If there are remaining horizontal cuts
        while i < len(horizontalCut):
            total_cost += horizontalCut[i] * v_pieces
            h_pieces += 1
            i += 1
        
        # If there are remaining vertical cuts
        while j < len(verticalCut):
            total_cost += verticalCut[j] * h_pieces
            v_pieces += 1
            j += 1
        
        return total_cost
